title: With any knock up LUX is still doing her ult.
body:
Impossible to argue with try it. She still ults. 
Why?

replies.body:
It's a windup, not a channel. I actually really hate it considering Karthus and Fiddlesticks can get CCed but they lose their multi-minute CD ults completely, not even getting a refresh while Lux's just goes off still. And hers is like 70-80 seconds level 1 with her CDR she gets from first item.

No risk to playing Lux, Compared to Xerath. Pretty similar concepts, full skill shot AP casters with a long range ult and some hard CC, but Xerath's ult can be stopped, whereas Lux's can't.

your kidding right {{champion:99}}  has plenty of risk 1 she has no escape, 2 all her ability's are skill shots, 3 she has high mana cost, 4 her base movement speed is one of the lowest is the game with only 330 base ms. Compared to {{champion:101}} who's ability's have one of the longest ranges in game, 2 his passive gives him back mana, 3 his base ms is 340 which makes him faster than lux and 4th if your ulting with {{champion:101}} in a place where an enemy champ cant hit you, then your playing him wrong, his ult covers something like a quarter of the map in a radius around him there is no reason for u to be any where near some one who can cancel his ult

Dude, you're defending Lux, LUX! 

Let that sink in for a second.
And your point I main lux. What's wrong with lux

So? People main Garen, it doesn't make him any more skilful to play.

Nothing is 'wrong' with Lux, she's just a very powerful champ that doesn't require a lot of effort to play. (and everyone knows this)

Her combo is more powerful and easier to hit than most other AP champs, giving her quite a big advantage over them a lot of the time.

Compare her and Taliyah for example. To hit Lux's full combo, you need to land Q... Thats it, once you land Q, you have to be a vegetable not to be able to proc your passive, land E then ult. 
For Taliyah to land her full combo, she needs to hit them with her E, then needs to hit them with her W, knock them back (in the right direction) into at least 4 rocks of her E, AND hit all 5 individual rocks from her Q..
So Taliyah has to hit 11 spells (none of which are guaranteed to hit) in order to land her full combo, Lux needs to land 1 spell, and then all her others are _guaranteed_.

So my point is, standing up in a court of law and saying "But he's a nice guy!" When the bodies of the people he's murdered are lying in the floor. just isn't a valid defence.

Its like Standing up and saying, "Garen and Yi don't have enough power". You cant defend them, its like arguing at a brick wall.

People know Lux is easy to play, one of the easiest mages. She has more damage than most mages, and very very strong CC. Thats just a fact. 
Standing up and trying to defend her low movement speed would get you laughed out of court. 

Lux is easier and more powerful than Anivia, and Anivia only has 325 movement speed. But it doesn't make Anivia weak.

Heaps of skills are "click to launch" and they will continue to cast even if you get stunned after "launching them" - the same goes for things like Darius ultimate, where if you flash out of its effective cast range - if he's already begun to cast it; it will follow your flash.

Other skills as well will continue when you are dead, Gnars boomerangs for instance - whereas some will not - there are special rules on these - certain Champions death deletes certain projectiles while others will continue.
